# Contributing to LykOS

Thank you for your interest in contributing! üéâ

Any form of contribution is welcome and appreciated. We highly encourage joining our [Discord server](https://discord.gg/M8ZwufDyvs) for better collaboration and assistance.

> By participating, you agree to follow our Code of Conduct.

## Ways to Contribute

- Open issues
  - [Report bugs](#reporting-bugs)
  - [Suggest enhancements](#suggesting-enhancements)
- Open pull requests
  - [Improve the codebase](#improving-the-codebase)
  - [Improve the documentation](#improving-the-documentation)
- [Join the project team](#joining-the-project-team)

> If you like the project but don‚Äôt have time for any of the options above, you can still contribute by:
> - starring the project ‚≠ê
> - joining the Discord community üåê

# Reporting Bugs

To create a bug report, open a new issue and choose the appropriate template.

Before opening a bug report, please check existing issues to avoid duplicates. Review the available templates and use the one that best fits your report.

## Suggesting Enhancements

To suggest an enhancement, open a new issue and choose the appropriate template.

## Improving the Codebase

Code contributions are the most valuable form of contribution at this stage of development.

To assist with this process, we have created the following documentation pages:
- [Building the project](https://git.lyk-os.org/LykOS/wiki/Building-and-Running) (WIP)
- Navigating the codebase (WIP)
- [Coding style](https://git.lyk-os.org/LykOS/wiki/Coding-Style) (WIP)

## Improving the Documentation

The source code for our docs can be found: [here](https://git.lyk-os.org/docs)

The website is available: [here](https://docs.lyk-os.org)

## Joining the Project Team

If you‚Äôre interested in becoming a long-term contributor, join the discussion on Discord.

Active, consistent contributors may be invited to help maintain and guide the project.
